page.title: 11Hartfield Village Centre
page.content: I (Paul) walked up Hartfield High Street.There are two pubs,The Anchor and The Hay Waggon.They both have good restaurants which attract people from miles around. There is a primary school with 100 children. There are 3 shops;Pooh Corner,selling gifts to do with the A.A.Milne stories,a general store and newsagents and a antique shop. There is also a post-office. In the centre is a water pump which still works.A road leads up to the church and doctor's house. There is a playing field called The Town Croft where they play football,cricket,stool ball and tennis. A childrens playground is also there. There is a old railway station which is now used as a play school.The line has been turned into a country park. We also have a war memorial.
